contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox website | name = Dogpile | logo = | screenshot = [[File:Dogpiledotcom search website.PNG|200px]] | caption = Dogpile's homepage (September 2012) | url = {{URL|http://www.dogpile.com/}} | commercial = | type = [[Metasearch engine]] | language = [[English language|English]] | registration = | owner = [[Blucora, Inc.]] | author = Aaron Flin | launch date = | current status = Active | revenue = | slogan = All the best search engines piled into one | alexa = {{IncreaseNegative}} 4,419 ({{as of|2013|7|06|alt=July 2013}})<ref name="alexa">{{cite web|url= http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/dogpile.com |title= Dogpile.com Site Info | publisher= [[Alexa Internet]] |accessdate= 2013-07-06 }}</ref><!--Updated monthly by OKBot.--> }} '''Dogpile''' is a search engine that fetches results from [[Google]], [[Yahoo!]], [[Yandex]], and includes results from several other popular [[search engine]]s, including those from audio and video content providers. It is a registered trademark of [[Blucora, Inc.]] == History == Dogpile began operation in November 1996. The site was created and developed by Aaron Flin and later sold to [[Infospace|Go2net]] (which was in turn acquired by [[Infospace]]). The Dogpile search engine earned the [[J.D. Power and Associates]] award for best Residential Online Search Engine Service in both 2006<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jdpower.com/corporate/news/releases/pressrelease.aspx?ID=2006219 |title=Residential Online Service Customer Satisfaction Study | J.D. Power and Associates |publisher=Jdpower.com |date=2006-10-11 |accessdate=2009-10-08}}</ref> and 2007.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jdpower.com/corporate/news/releases/pressrelease.aspx?ID=2007242 |title=2007 Residential Online Service Customer Satisfaction Study | J.D. Power and Associates |publisher=Jdpower.com |date=2007-10-17 |accessdate=2009-10-08}}</ref> Dogpile started a campaign in 2008 to use proceeds from site traffic to raise US$1 million for animals in need.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prnewswire.com/mnr/infospace/35692/ |title=Dogpile.com Lends A Paw to ASPCA with $1 Million Fundraising Campaign | With Video |publisher=Prnewswire.com |date=2008-11-12 |accessdate=2009-10-08}}</ref> In July 2010, Dogpile was ranked the 770th most popular website in the U.S., and 2548th most popular in the world by Alexa. Quantcast estimated 2.0 million unique U.S. visitors a month, and Compete estimated 1,953,280.<ref>[http://www.alexa.com/siteinfo/dogpile.com "Dogpile.com Site Info"], ''Alexa'', retrieved 8-29-2010</ref><ref>[http://www.quantcast.com/dogpile.com "Dogpile.com-- Quantcast Audience Profile"], ''Quantcast'', retrieved 8-29-2010</ref><ref>[http://siteanalytics.compete.com/dogpile.com/ "Site Profile for dogpile.com"], ''Compete'', retrieved 8-29-2010</ref> Dogpile formerly fetched results from [[Ask.com|Ask]] and [[Bing]]. == See also == *[[InfoSpace]] *[[Metasearch engine]] *[[MetaCrawler]] *[[WebCrawler]] *[[List of search engines]] == References == {{reflist}} == External links == * {{official website|http://www.dogpile.com/}} * [http://www.jdpower.com/corporate/news/releases/pressrelease.aspx?ID=2007242 JD Power Study on Online Behavior] * [http://websearch.about.com/od/enginesanddirectories/a/dogpile.htm] [[Category:Internet search engines]] [[Category:Internet properties established in 1996]] {{searchengine-website-stub}}
